content.question: The rate at which people arrive at a theater box office is modeled by the function <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="B of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in people per minute and <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes. The graph of <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the figure above. Which of the following is closest to the number of people that arrive at the box office during the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
